results.title: The Empty nest
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Kress, Judith Kress and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Tells of the threat of extinction to the osprey (fish hawk); since 1950, 90% of these birds have vanished due to the effects of pesticides. Studies the bird’s courtship, rearing of young, flight patterns and habits. Tells of the effects of pesticides in relation to the food chain.

results.title: People you'd like to know: Paige
results.creator_credit: Janet Weaver and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description: A look at the integrating of a child with Down’s Syndrome into a regular school. Notes the protective attitude of the child who has taken Paige “under her wing”. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: People you'd like to know: Kai: cleft lip and palate
results.brief_description: Focuses on a young boy who was born with a cleft lip and palate. Shows how he has learnt to cope with his condition and adjusted to his surroundings. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: People you'd like to know: John: cystic fibrosis
results.creator_credit: Janet Weaver and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description: Shows the extent of the problems caused by cystic fibrosis, a crippling congestive disease which may affect the pancreas, lungs and other organs, though giving few outward signs of its presence. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Diana: amputee
results.creator_credit: Janet Weaver, Rebecca Eaton and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description: A delightful study of a young girl who underwent a leg amputation because of a cancerous tumour. Shows how she learnt to cope with her disability and adjusted to her surroundings learning to ski on one leg at Darby Dogue Farm, Concord, Massachusetts.

results.title: People you'd like to know: Dee: Larsen's Syndrome
results.creator_credit: Janet Weaver and WGBH Educational Foundation
results.brief_description: Dee has Larsen’s Syndrome - a disease which affects bone formation and joint location. She needs leg braces and canes to walk, but her outlook is optimistic and positive. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Orientation of the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Looks at the relationship of the viewer to the screen, and the way in which attention is absorbed into the world of the filmmaker, affecting the viewer’s own orientation. Notes also the physical support of the camera and its orientation in space.

group_siblings.title: Lenses and perspective: how does it look from where you are?
Shot sizes and framing faults: Episode 2

results.title: Movement and moving the camera
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Illustrates movement within the frame, movement of the frame and movement of the camera. Notes the creation of the sense of movement without moving the frame, and how and when the camera can be used subjectively. Narrated by Peter Thompson.

group_siblings.title: Lenses and perspective: how does it look from where you are?
Shot sizes and framing faults: Episode 2

results.title: Lenses and perspective: how does it look from where you are?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Lessons in visual language”.
Lays to rest the mistaken idea that focal length affects the appearance of depth. Demonstrates that the camera-to-subject distance is the governing factor in the perception of spatial relationships in the third dimension. Devised and narrated by Peter Thompson.
